abstract.text: This protocol provides a mechanism for chaining different validators together into a
single validator that can perform a single validation function. This protocol also
forms a basis for defining common validation function such as validating that
collections aren’t empty, or that collections have a specific amount of elements, etc.

A swift abstraction for defining types of data commonly rendered within a Graphical User Interface (GUI). This package provides
the means to define, validate, and relate different forms of data.
Satisfies a validation function when a value exists within a given set.
All characters within a string must be alphabetic (a-z, A-Z), numeric (0-9), or underscores (_).

Protocol for defining a validation function that can be enacted on a Root object.
This protocol provides a mechanism for chaining different validators together into a
single validator that can perform a single validation function. This protocol also
forms a basis for defining common validation function such as validating that
collections aren’t empty, or that collections have a specific amount of elements, etc.
All characters within a string must be numeric (0-9).
A type-erased validator.
Satisfies a validation if a sequence pointed to by a path
contains a given value when
transformed by function
. This method transforms a sequence pointed to by
and passes a validation if a value is within the new transformed sequence.
Container for storing validation functions for values specified with a Path.
Path to a value containing validation rules.
Push a new validation function onto the stack of existing validators.
A simple interface for chaining together different validators. This factory can be reused to create a
validator that may perform the task of several validators chained together. This factory will
store a function to generate a complex validation rule that can be modified/altered to work with
other validators. When the user is satisfied with the validation rule, this factory may be used
to generate the validator as many times as required by using the
function.
Path to a value that can only be read and never mutated.
The validator type used by this protocol.
All characters must be alphabetic (a-z, A-Z), numeric (0-9), underscores (_) or dashes (-).

for defining multiple validators.
Creates a new validator that checks whether a given string matches a banned word. If
the string matches the banned word, then the validation will fail.

Creates a validator that checks that a transformed sequence contains unique elements, i.e. no

ValidationError is an error that occurs when validating.
The first character in a string must be alphabetic (a-z, A-Z).
The first character in a given string must be alphabetic (a-z, A-Z) or an underscore (_).
Verifies that a given string contain a substring that exists within a list of permissible
